Decision: Implement Brambles moratorium on new analytics tools without prior approval
Description: No new (in-scope) analytics tools are to be procured (across Brambles) without approval from Head of Global D&A + TS (who?)

Decision: Designate Github Copilot as the exclusive pair coding assistant for D&A software development
Description: a) Agree Github Copilot as preferred D&A tool b) qualifying D&A roles &  access approval c) policies for use alongside VS Code & DBX Assistant d) blacklisting of alternative coding assistants

Decision: Migrate all Data Science data storage off local machines into cloud environments
Description: To improve our data security, and make "hidden" compute loads visible, reconfigure all DS team members tool compute usage and data storage on to cloud-hosted platforms

Decision: Implement a consumption-based tool recharge mechanism from Global D&A to regions
Description: To support future tool migration work, and to avoid blockers arising from Digital D&A budget limitations, agree a recharge mechanism with Finance and the regions so that analytics tool costs can be re-allocated in proportion to regions' usage. Re-use our existing FinOps processes and teams for this.

Decision: Designate Soda as the Brambles-wide data observability tool & activate onboarding processes
Description: a) make the Soda tool available to all D&A teams b) promote awareness c) agree recharge mechanism (consumption-based) d) retire Evidently and GE tools

Decision: Migrate AMERICAS SQL server workloads to Databricks
Description: Migrate high priority analytics AMERICAS analytics workloads to Databricks from SQL SSIS & SSMS tools. This will produce a more integrated experience for analytic producers, better quaity products, and opex savings from legacy tool retirement

Decision: Evaluate Alteryx vs Dataiku as the designated low-code data science tool for Global Finance Control team
Description: Proceed with evaluation, using the existing Finance Alteryx community and their existing use cases as real-world context for comparison.

Decision: Select & procure a designated graph database product for Brambles
Description: a) We need a mandated enterprise-wide graph database tool b) implement selection, procurement & onboarding

Decision: Onboard AMERICAS D&A team to the Databricks platform
Description: Databricks access provided to AMERICAS data scientists, engineers, analysts, BI developers. Existing LATAM, NA, and CAN workspaces, compute resources & data catalogs consolidated into a unified AMERICAS collection. Learning needs assessment conducted by Databricks & customised training plan designed.

Decision: Designate A2A & MCP as the default protocols for agentic AI across Brambles
Description: Immediate adoption of two complementary open standards: Agent-to-Agent Protocol (A2A) and Model Context Protocol (MCP) as our enterprise foundation for agent-agent and agent-tool interworking. The alternative, fragmented proprietary solutions or no standards, risks creating expensive technical debt, vendor lock-in, and inability to participate in the emerging AI agent ecosystem.

Decision: Adjust scope & terms of the D&A Solution Review Board (SRB) and re-launch
Description: Adjust scope & terms of the D&A Solution Review Board (SRB) and re-launch
